description:
## Grid Cell and Subgrid Registration

Register horizontal grid cells and subgrid together.

**This issue creates TWO entities:**
1. Horizontal grid cells (cell properties: resolution, region, grid type)
2. Horizontal subgrid (variable types using these cells)

**Result:** Subgrid ID (e.g., s100) to use in Horizontal Computational Grid registration.

**If you need multiple subgrids** (e.g., staggered grids), submit this form multiple times - once per subgrid.
## Part 1: Horizontal Grid Cells\n\nDefine the physical grid cell characteristics.

label: Grid Cells Description
description:
Description of these grid cells.

Include resolution and purpose.

Example: 'Regular latitude-longitude grid at 1.25° × 0.9° resolution for atmospheric mass variables'
placeholder: e.g., ORCA1 tripolar ocean grid cells

label: Grid Type
description: How cells are distributed over the region.

label: Coordinate System
description: Coordinate reference system.

label: Region
description: Geographic region(s) covered by the grid.

label: Temporal Refinement
description: How the grid varies with time.

label: X Resolution
description: Cell size in X direction (longitude for spherical).\n\nOmit if varies >25%.

label: Y Resolution
description: Cell size in Y direction (latitude for spherical).\n\nOmit if varies >25%.

label: Resolution Units
description: Units for resolution values.\n\nRequired if resolution provided.

label: Number of Cells
description: Total number of horizontal cells.\n\nLeave blank if variable (adaptive grids).

label: Southernmost Latitude
description: Southernmost latitude in degrees north.\n\n-90 to 90. Leave blank if not lat-lon.

label: Westernmost Longitude
description: Westernmost longitude in degrees east.\n\n0 to <360. Leave blank if not lat-lon.
### Spectral Grid Options (if applicable)

label: Truncation Method
description: Spherical harmonic truncation method.\n\nOnly for spectral grids.

label: Truncation Number
description: Zonal wave number for spectral truncation.\n\nOnly for spectral grids.

## Part 2: Horizontal Subgrid

Define what variables are calculated at these grid cell locations.

This creates the subgrid entity that references the grid cells from Part 1.

label: Subgrid Description
description: Description of this subgrid.\n\nExample: 'Mass variables on regular latitude-longitude grid'
placeholder: e.g., Velocity components on staggered grid positions

label: Cell Variable Types
description: Types of variables at this subgrid location.

## What Will Be Generated

This issue creates:

1. **horizontal_grid_cells** (ID: g###)
   - Contains: Grid type, resolution, cell count, region (from Part 1)

2. **horizontal_subgrid** (ID: s###)
   - Contains: Variable types (from Part 2)
   - Auto-linked to: Grid cells entity (g###)

**You'll receive:** Subgrid ID (s###)

**Next:** Use subgrid ID in Horizontal Computational Grid issue.
## Issue Handling Metadata

label: Issue Kind
description: Select whether this is a new submission or modification.
